result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon Jay Beutler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • False Imprisonment [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case called at 11:29 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Brandon Jay Beutler in court with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing Arguments by Counsel; Statement by Jenean Cooper

On Counts #2 & #3, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, each count, concurrent, with conditions:
--serve 45 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-release privileges (on Ct#2); to commence 10/2/15 by 6:00 pm 
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--Complete certified batterers' intervention programming
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--No contact with Amber R. Mayer
--No possession of dangerous weapon
--No acts/threats of violence towards any person
--To pay costs of $268 (Ct#2)
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge (Ct#2)
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand (Ct#2)
--To pay $243 (Ct#3)
--To pay $200 DNA Surcharge (Ct#3)
--To pay $165 subpoena fees

Days credit for time already served: 1 day
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given
Recess: 11:51 am
Sentencing hearing at 09-08-2015 11:00 am
Transcript of preliminary hearing held on 02-19-2015 before the Honorable Judge Koschnick
with elements/JI's and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.
Scheduling Notice

Case called at 2:40 pm [sf] [Case was set for FSSC]
Defendant Brandon Jay Beutler in court with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Rhiel advises that they have come to a plea agreement and that he is requesting the sentencing date be set out.
  
Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count # 2 & #3; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #1.

Attorney Rhiel requests a sentencing in late September.
DA Happ has concerns regarding length of delay. 
Court and counsel discuss setting of sentecing date, set in a week or 2.
Court directs clerk to contact JA for dates.
Court notes for the record that it is considering delaying the start of the jail sentence.

Case called at 1:17 pm
Defendant Brandon Jay Beutler in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office (PD appears for bond purposes only). Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint  appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court verifies with the Defendant that the DOB and address listed on the criminal complaint are correct.
Defendant advises that he will have a new address and provides that address to the Court.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charges and maximum penalties recited; waiver of reading of charge 3 penalties and facts
Court finds that the criminal complaint states probable cause.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $5,000.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No acts or threats of violence 
-No contact with Amber Mayer
-No presence at the residence of Amber Mayer,except defendant may return to shared residence one time with law enforcement to obtain his personal belongings
-No discussion of the facts of the case with Linda Schultz

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given
Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient.
